intro: Alonsoa linearifolia var. platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, flat leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and mangrove forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
